column4: just run 'sudo iptables -L' to look at your currently active firewall rules. If you get an "empty" response, nothing on the ubuntu side will prevent you from syncing with your Pocket PC
Thanks will try that... I have a hardware router too with firewall so I wanted to see if that was covered, though I wouldn't think that'd interfere between a PC<-->PocketPC connection
it shouldn't, if both your PC and PPC are on the LAN and the router just shields you from the public internet.
K thanks - I can't seem to sync and I suspect that might be the issue... Pocket Pc recognized/connects but doesn't transfer info...
are you following the howto on the forums site?
This one: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/PortableDevices/WindowsMobile
I hadn't seen this one. Check out http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=30936 -- it has some extra troubleshooting stuff
Thanks - will do...
I've given up on Pocket PC syncing myself. Waiting for the consumer OpenMoko phone now...

There's something called "opensync" which is based off multisync or something, too...  Was able to get my Dad's Sony "Clie" (Palm) to sync at any rate. I can get Pocket Pc to connect, just not sync with Evolution...
please recommend the package installation for flash, not the firefox-based one
They are one in the same now (the flash)
when there is a Ubuntu package, you should recommend using it
The addons menu of FF uses the Ubuntu Packages (for Flash and other ones available)
I can't verify that here. Can you point me to some place where that is documented?
No, though it was general knowledge (?) that they switch to that as a feature of either Hardy or Edgy..
you're essentially saying that firefox interfaces with apt. I don't think that's the case.
I'd go vice versa and use sudo on both ( TheMaxzilla
It's a compound statement, so I don't beleive it's necessary (I may be wrong, though)
the sudo will not have an effect on the second aptitude call
O.K. I'll take your word for it :)
aptitude clean does something different
